references.paper_title: Counterfactual explanations without opening the black box: Automated decisions and the GDPR
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of algorithmic recourse, introducing the concept and highlighting its importance in the context of the GDPR.
This paper introduces the concept of actionable recourse, a crucial element in making algorithmic recourse practically relevant and impactful.

references.paper_title: Algorithmic recourse: From counterfactual explanations to interventions
references.reason: This work offers a comprehensive overview of algorithmic recourse, connecting counterfactual explanations to interventions and outlining key challenges.

references.paper_title: A survey of algorithmic recourse: Contrastive explanations and consequential recommendations
references.reason: This survey paper systematically analyzes the existing literature on algorithmic recourse, providing a structured overview of different approaches and their limitations.

references.paper_title: Algorithmic recourse in the wild: Understanding the impact of data and model shifts
references.reason: This paper emphasizes the need to consider real-world factors and potential challenges such as data shifts and evolving environments when designing algorithmic recourse solutions.
